newsitem.title: USA: AMERICAN HOLDINGS INC FILES IPO, TO RAISE $250 MLN.
newsitem.headline: AMERICAN HOLDINGS INC FILES IPO, TO RAISE $250 MLN.

text.p: American Holdings Inc, parent of American Skiing Co, said Wednesday it filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the initial public offering of $250 million of its common shares.

Proceeds will be used to fund the company's acqusition of Steamboat Ski Resort in Steamboat Springs, Colo., and the Heavenly Ski Resort near Lake Tahoe on the California/Nevada border, and to repay debt, it said.
The offering will be made through Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette Securities Corp, Furman Selz, Morgan Stanley Dean Witter and Schroder & Co Inc, it said.
ASC said it expects to complete the offering in October.

ASC owns the Canyon ski resort near Park City, Utah. Amercan Skiing owns the Mount Snow, Haystack, Killington, Pico and Sugarbush ski resorts in Vermont; the Attitash Bear Peak ski resort in New Hampshire; and the Sunday River and Sugarloaf/USA ski resorts in Maine.
